kodkod.core.solvers
Interface SATSolver

All Known Implementing Classes:
MiniSAT
public interface SATSolver

Provides an interface to a SAT solver.

Author:
Emina Torlak
specfield:
literals: set int
clauses: set seq[literals]
invariant:
all i: [2..) | i in literals => i-1 in literals

Method Summary
 void addClause(int[] lits)
          Adds the specified sequence of literals to this.clauses.
 void addVariables(int numVars)
          Adds the specified number of new variables to the solver's vocabulary.
 IntSet falseVariables(int start, int end)
          Returns the literals in the range [start..end] that have been set to FALSE by the most recent call to solve().
 int numberOfClauses()
          Returns the number of clauses added to the solver so far.
 int numberOfVariables()
          Returns the size of this solver's vocabulary.
 void setTimeout(int seconds)
          Sets the timeout of this solver to the specified number of seconds.
 boolean solve()
          Returns true if there is a satisfying assignment for this.clauses.
 int timeout()
          Returns the maximum amount of time that this.solver will spend trying to find a solution.

          Returns the literals in the range [start..end] that have been set to TRUE by the most recent call to solve().

          Returns the truth value assigned to the given literal by the most recent call to solve().
 

Method Detail

numberOfVariables

int numberOfVariables()
Returns the size of this solver's vocabulary.

Returns:
#this.literals

numberOfClauses

int numberOfClauses()
Returns the number of clauses added to the solver so far.

Returns:
#this.clauses

timeout

int timeout()
Returns the maximum amount of time that this.solver will spend trying to find a solution.

Returns:
the timeout (in seconds)

setTimeout

void setTimeout(int seconds)
Sets the timeout of this solver to the specified number of seconds. If a solution is not found in the given timeframe, the solver terminates with a TimeoutException.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - seconds < 0
effects:
sets the timeout to the given number of seconds

addVariables

void addVariables(int numVars)
Adds the specified number of new variables to the solver's vocabulary.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - numVars < 0
effects:
this.literals' = [1..#this.literals + numVars]

addClause

void addClause(int[] lits)
Adds the specified sequence of literals to this.clauses. No reference to the specified array is kept, so it can be reused.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - - lits = null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - some i: [0..lits.length) | |lits[0]| > #this.literals
effects:
this.clauses' = this.clauses + lits

solve

boolean solve()
              throws TimeoutException
Returns true if there is a satisfying assignment for this.clauses. Otherwise returns false. If this.clauses are satisfiable, the satisfying assignment can be obtained by calling trueVariables(int, int), falseVariables(int, int), or valueOf(int).

Returns:
true if this.clauses are satisfiable; otherwise false.
Throws:
TimeoutException - - the solver could not determine the satisfiability of the problem within this.timeout() seconds.

trueVariables

IntSet trueVariables(int start,
                     int end)
Returns the literals in the range [start..end] that have been set to TRUE by the most recent call to solve().

Returns:
the true literals between start and end
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - start > end || [start..end] !in this.literals
java.lang.IllegalStateException - - solve() has not been called, or the call terminated with an exception.

falseVariables

IntSet falseVariables(int start,
                      int end)
Returns the literals in the range [start..end] that have been set to FALSE by the most recent call to solve().

Returns:
the false literals between start and end
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - start > end || [start..end] !in this.literals
java.lang.IllegalStateException - - solve() has not been called, or the call terminated with an exception.

valueOf

java.lang.Boolean valueOf(int literal)
Returns the truth value assigned to the given literal by the most recent call to solve(). If the value of the given literal did not affect the result of the last solution, null is returned.

Returns:
the value of the given literal
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - literal !in this.literals
java.lang.IllegalStateException - - solve() has not been called, or the call terminated with an exception.
